findings.title: Literal value instead of decimals
findings.description: Using literal values representing the number of decimals of the token instead of the defined 'decimals' variable can lead to errors if the code needs to be modified and affects readability.

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
Contract Owner Can Arbitrarily Alter y+2 Reserve Pool
findings.description: The `endCrowdsale` function of the `RGEToken` contract allows the contract owner to end the crowdsale, transferring the provided `unsold` amount to the `reserveY2` pool. The owner can arbitrarily increase or decrease the reserve y+2 pool by calling this function multiple times.

findings.title: startCrowdsaleYx functions can be called with a crowdsale parameter equal to address(0)
findings.description: The startCrowdsaleYx functions do not check if the crowdsale parameter is different from address(0), which can cause issues when calling endCrowdsale and require re-calling startCrowdsaleYx to set crowdsale to the correct address.
